name: AWS cross account roles Exceptions.txt - PingSafe Alert
description: This section provides information about external AWS accounts that are authorized to assume roles within the organization's AWS accounts. It serves as a reference list that should be updated whenever new trusted external accounts are added or removed.
use_cases: Managing access for external parties or partners
Auditing and controlling external account access

name: AWS cross account roles Exceptions.txt - Trusted External Accounts
description: This section lists external AWS account IDs that are trusted by the organization for specific purposes. These account IDs likely belong to third-party services or vendors that require cross-account access to perform their intended functions within the organization's AWS environment. The list serves as a reference for authorized external accounts that have been granted trust relationships.
use_cases: Granting access to third-party monitoring services (e.g., SumoLogic, DataDog, Coralogix)
Enabling integration with cloud cost management tools (e.g., CloudZero)
Allowing access for security and compliance scanning tools (e.g., PingSafe, Cloudsploit)
Facilitating integration with data platforms and services (e.g., Databricks, Qubole, Redis Labs)
